data.title: Support marker matches with startLine, startColumn and endColumn
Multiple projects in Editor?
data.body:
Is there any chance to have multiple projects in editor? 

Mostly i want to copy/paste some modules that i wrote and every time i need to open project then copy that code and then again open back that current project that i am working and paste code.

That is really annoying for me.

data.title: Terminal in editor?
data.body: Is there any chance to have terminal built in editor?

data.title: TypeScript: Rename refactoring stops at destructured objects
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.1.0-insider
- OS Version: Windows 8.1 x64

Steps to Reproduce:
1. [Destructure](https://basarat.gitbooks.io/typescript/content/docs/destructuring.html) an object of some known TS class or interface
2. Rename a member in the class or interface that is referenced in the destructuring statement

Expect: The destructured member name to be updated to matched the renamed symbol
Get: The destructured member is not updated, causing a TS compilation error

See attached gif

![typescript_rename_destructuring](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/563860/15135901/015834a0-16bf-11e6-88dc-2dbc8ef523da.gif)

data.title: Symbols and IntelliSense don't work at all
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.1.0
- OS Version: OS X 10.11.4

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Open any TypeScript file
2. Open symbols, find all references, go to definition, etc.

Expected Result:

It should work.

Actual Result:

No symbols, no references, etc.

---

Not sure what I might be doing wrong. I've tried uninstalling/reinstalling VS Code and deleting ~/Library/Application Support/Code, and nothing seems to work. This definitely used to work back when I started using VS Code a year or so ago, but some time in the last few months it stopped working for no apparent reason.

data.title: Proposal: Ability to move Debugging bar - or auto-shift for long file location paths
data.body:
Is it possible to have the `debugging bar`? It's difficult to see the file currently being viewed in when you're stepping through a debug process.

It'd be nice for it to either (self-shift) for long _location paths_ or be able to move it someplace yourself. When debugging through large Node applications you can't see exactly what file you're working on, or where it is located. You have to constantly hover over the tab to see it.

Love code otherwise, great job guys :)

data.title: Shift click multi-selection not as expected in Git viewlet
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.1.0-alpha
- OS Version: Windows 10

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Make some changes on a few files (more than 5)
2. Change to the Git viewlet
3. Click on a file under changes in the middle (file 3)
4. Hold shift
5. Click on file 5 (should have files 3-5 selected)
6. Keep holding shift, click on file 2.

In file explorer clicking files above or below while holding shift only selects the files above or below the originally clicked file. I would expect the same behavior here.

data.title: Very large editor wrapping column incorrectly wraps
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.1.0
- OS Version: Windows 10

I just updated to 1.1.0, and as soon as VSCode reopened the folder I was using prior to prompting the update the editor was broken. Broken in the way that each line only shows a single character.

![](http://i.imgur.com/6l8V3FB.png)

_I was looking at some code from an old University exam._

Pressing <kbd>Alt</kbd> + <kbd>Z</kbd> (View -> Toggle Word Wrap) fixed the problem. But when I close VSCode and/or open another file or folder, the problem is right back where we started.

data.title: Support relative paths in output and repl

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.0
- OS Version: OSX Yosemite

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Setup project with task runner that outputs tsc output to Output window with TSC 1.6.  Notice it uses full path names and you can click on a path to go to the file.
2. Upgrade project to TSC 1.8.  It now uses relative file paths and you can't click on them anymore.

with TypeScript 1.6 (working):http://imgur.com/sIQLu8I
with TypeScript 1.8 (broken): http://imgur.com/qePitPw

I have a pretty vanilla tasks.json that calls grunt (which uses grunt-ts). The output seems to match [line 80](https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/blob/master/src/vs/workbench/parts/output/common/outputWorker.ts#L80) here, yet I can't click the lines to navigate.  I believe this is because of a recent tsc version update to 1.8, and I downgraded back to 1.6 to verify.

data.title: Errors and warnings not updated after changing language mode
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.1.0-alpha
- OS Version: Windows 10

Related: #5193 

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Open a JavaScript file, mine by default had no errors.
2. On the bottom toolbar click JavaScript to change language mode
3. Select CSS
4. Observe that the error count has changed
5. Change language mode back to JavaScript

Errors are not removed until the file is removed from working files or restarting Code.

data.title: Intellisense no longer working? How to re-enable?
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.0.0
- OS Version: 10.11.4

I'm not sure exactly when this was disabled, but I used to get the Intellisense inline suggests without any special configuration.  i.e. I'm in a single javascript file, I declare a function that has an unused locally scoped variable, and Intellisense underlines it.  

This no longer happens and I'm not seeing an obvious way to reenable this?  If I used globals that weren't defined, it also used to prompt to allow downloading of the typings file (e.g. for node), but that's also stopped.

data.title: Call Stack view doesn't show the "stopped reason" if stackTraceRequest returns error
data.body:
In the latest an error returned from stackTraceRequest is shown nicely, but the stopped reason isn't:

![2016-05-09 17-58-56](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1898161/15119329/b02ba03e-1610-11e6-86d9-d52fd48e4978.png)

If the debug adapter returns the error as a fake stack frame instead, the reason is shown correctly:

![2016-05-09 18-04-04](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1898161/15119357/d367ecc4-1610-11e6-93ea-6f5ad9fcb5cb.png)

3. blur from Quick Command Action then it disappears and stops searching.

data.title: Closing an unsaved file window is not showing the confirmation
data.body:

**Steps to Reproduce:**
1. Open VS Code for any project
2. Create a new file
3. Write some text and close the window (Use either Ctrl + w or 'x' button)

**Expected**
- A confirmation dialog asking to save or cancel

**Actual**
- Window closes and file remains under working directory as is

data.title: isWatching task as preLaunchTask in launch.json

milestone.title: On Deck
milestone.description:
The Issues assigned to the **On Deck** milestone under consideration for the upcoming milestones.
Our goal is to always have less than 100 Issues on deck.

data.body:
It would be nice to have a watcher task as preLaunchTask in launch.json. At the moment this is not possible because the launch task will not start before the preLaunchTask ends.
A long running preLaunchTask should have a regex similar to problemMatcher to wait for a specific text in the output window before executing the launch task.
In my scenario I'm running webpack dev server as a watcher task. I want this task to run if <kbd>F5</kbd> is hit and the preLaunchTask is not running. To delay the debugger launch it would be useful to test for a specific string in the output window `webpack: bundle is now VALID.`

data.title: Read from OutputChannel in a vscode extension
data.body: I want to read logging information from the Tasks OutputChannel and show a status bar information based on this data. I can only find a way to append text to a OutputChannel but no api to register to an output changed event. Is this scenario currently supported? Is there another way to get output from a running vscode task within an extension?

data.title: C# intellisense doesn't show return type
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.0.0
- OS Version: OSX El Capitan

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Using intellisense in C# the output shows the methods available but it does not show the return type of that method.  I think this has been in Omnisharp from day 1 so would be nice to get this in.
2. More info here :  https://twitter.com/jchannon/status/728502404346462208

data.title: [less] syntax highlight failed when value starts with decimal point
fix #6062 and #1064
data.body:
fix #6062  and #1064.
cbbcf73 and 65966e3 may not support sass and stylus file. 
`.sass` and `.stylus(.styl)` should be treated `sass`.

data.title: Different color scheme for references modal
data.body:
- VSCode Version: Version 1.0.0 (1.0.0)
- OS Version: Mac OSX EL Capitan

When clicking on references the modal has a different theme from the one which  I selected in VS code.

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Change the theme to something other than the default.
2. Click on References and the modal has a different color scheme.
